website_summaries.verdict: The AAXA P700 is a very portable DLP-based LED projector that does a better job at displaying text than video, making it a good choice for presentations to small groups.
pros: Good set of ports for a compact LED projector
cons: Apparent scaling artifacts visible at the projector's native resolution

customer_reviews.title: Seriously amazing (just a little too loud)
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is AMAZING. Bought for work conferences and works flawlessly. Totally bright enough even in a well lit room, and I can carry it to the show with just a backpack!! The only downside is it is LOUD. A non-issue in a large conference room but if you were buying this for movies at home it would be prohibitively loud and would ruin the viewing experience.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: Small, fairly bright and very useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little projector for many purposes. I bought it because I needed a battery driven projector to be used in the field or in the studio, to project images onto a model for photography purposes. However, this is also powerful enough to give an actual presentation, if needed, or as a backup for my talks at camera clubs, in case the main projector dies mid-presentation. The built-in memory slot allows me to store images to be used, I just wished that it would store the thumbnails instead of recreating them each time, which is slow and tedious.
customer_reviews.author: Jurgen LobertTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great colors, a little loud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our church to replace an ancient projector. The colors are vivid and the image can be huge and still be clear. It's tiny but a little loud, less noticeable when more people are in the room. I bought a separate lightning to HDMI connector for the Mac and HDMI to HDMI cable for the PC. I also bought a carrying case for storage. We love how easy it is to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Clark

customer_reviews.title: Distorted and squeezed images plus noisy
customer_reviews.text: Images are distorted. (See my pictures) I use this projector for drawing but the images are squezed. I contacted the manufacturer and they said to change the image ratios. I tried everything and nothing worked. I will send this product back! The regular (no Pro) is better. Plus this projector is very noisy compared to my previous one. I have the same projector, except that this time I went all the way to fing what it seems an upgrade. Many new cool features but very noisy and my remote doesn't work, so I am going for a replacement. The projection is very clear tho, but hard to watch a movie near the projector.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great small projector with large projection.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous projector. Replacing a very old large projector that was bulky to store and bring back and forth. (Had to devote a whole rolling computer bag.) This P700 Pro is easy to carry (small and lightweight) and projects great for our meetings of 30 people. Some said the fan is loud - which is true, but that's just if you're sitting right next to it. I love it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Martin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little projector!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for quick movie nites outside this summer. My first projector and after about five movies so far this season I am very impressed. Picture is bright/great. It's an easy and quick set up with the HDMI connection. I just connect my device of choice (Apple TV, Roku, etc) and stream away. A quick audio out line to my portable speaker (UE megaboom, beats pill, whatever) and I'm at the movies in my backyard. Nice product. I'd definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Very Very noisy
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like it would be a good deal but this projector is so noisy I cannot use it for presentations. I tried it too late for a return (It sat in its box until I needed it) So $200+ wasted. I really wanted a plug and play - that i could just plug in a flash drive with a powerpoint but it doesnt seem to do that although it will project pictures and videos from a flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality components
customer_reviews.text: I had this projector for about a year. I use it as my backup to my large projector. Since I got it the on/off button, has been a little loose. Where when you slide it to the on position it would not click as it does when you turn it off. But still since it turned on I just kept it. I used it for three presentations, and when I tried for my 4th presentation it would not turn on, with or without battery or charger. I suspect the flaw with the on / off switch materialized. I tried tech support number left VM but no luck yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jose S.

customer_reviews.title: Buy the cheaper one
customer_reviews.text: This projector sells with bells and whistles but is incompitent in its usage. I could never sucessfully log onto the internet, the projector did not upload, the projector would shut off it was tilted on its side, you could not easily look a video. And worst of all I can't return it. I demand a refund!!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Clear!
customer_reviews.text: Totally pleased with this purchase. I reviewed mid sized projectors for years (literally 2 years) before i purchased this and im glad that this was my choice. I use it in my classroom and at home and it's bright even during the day without the use of black out curtains. My students enjoy class more and my son is ecstatic when his cartoons appear on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Renah Wallace

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Easy to use, intuitive enough interface, bright projection. Wish the battery life were longer, but it will do a job nearly nothing else can do at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: I love that it is compact
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is compact, has a built-in battery and comes with all connectors and a tripod. Nice! The only disappointment is the remote control has grey buttons on a black background. Really? You only use projectors in the dark. How are you supposed to see that?
customer_reviews.author: Mobius

customer_reviews.title: First one I got had a bad power switch
customer_reviews.text: First one I got had a bad power switch. The second one had a firmware problem. Brightness on it was very good but the fan Sound was way too loud and the speaker was way too low. Even with the project far away and with external speaker the fan was still too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great combination of HD picture quality and higher lumen power with portability
customer_reviews.text: perfect combination of clear picture and portability. The pico projectors under 200 lumens really only work in a dark room or at night. For professional presentations in the day, this is the best combination I've found for the price. Screen reshaping feature really makes this project great from any angle that you need.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable.
customer_reviews.text: A lot better than other in this size but, still very expensive and could be better in all categories.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: each has given me very good performance. This model helps me a lot with ...
customer_reviews.text: It is the third one I buy , each has given me very good performance. This model helps me a lot with its integrated battery
customer_reviews.author: HECTOR MASTERS

customer_reviews.title: Presentations on Power Point are crystal clear and the size ...
customer_reviews.text: Presentations on Power Point are crystal clear and the size and weight are really convenient. However, it is slow to start up and respond to remote control, and photos show up grainy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven N.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but loud fan noise and over saturated color
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but loud fan noise and over saturated color. It seems like the noise can be eliminated if I took it apart and packed the vibrating pieces with paper or something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Project.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and compact -- great picture, VERY good brightness. Works flawlessly with every Mac and PC tried to date/
customer_reviews.author: Glen Miranker

customer_reviews.title: Best value for business that need a compact projector.
customer_reviews.text: Best compact and portable projector available for the money invested.
customer_reviews.author: John Rees

customer_reviews.title: Not working straight out the box
customer_reviews.text: Defectuos item. Colors didn't work and nothing could be seen besides gray lines. Sent back for a refund and will be looking for another option!
customer_reviews.author: Malte Holm

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't charge
customer_reviews.text: Had to wait almost a month to get it. The quality of the picture is good , but the battery doesn't charge. Very disappointed as i needed this for an international business trip next week, but now i have to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: very nice and bright at 650 lumens
customer_reviews.text: very nice and bright at 650 lumens. I wish there was an operational manual with it but not a proble going to internet for users manual
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a bit noisey but if you have a speaker or headphones its not an issue
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate - quite bright in a small room.
customer_reviews.author: CLRF0

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is very good. I like it. It is portable. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Maria Joseph Savariappan

customer_reviews.title: Projector
customer_reviews.text: The portability is great. The focus is adequate for powerpoint and spreadsheets but probably not the best for video.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this was awesome! just great.. crisp clear.. portable.. even at 100in it was clear..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The image quality is very good and the battery lasts 70 min
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is very good and the battery lasts 70 min. I was concerned about the brightness in the classrooms and the capacity of the projector but it works really well.The problem I have is the noise. When used to maximum capacity, the noise can be really annoying. I'm a teacher and sometimes I work in small classrooms. The solution I found is to use it in ECO mode so the noise is not that disturbing but you get a bit less brightness..
customer_reviews.author: Hernan P.

customer_reviews.title: Focus control is not precise enough. Seems to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Focus control is not precise enough. Seems to be mis-aligned. Text is focused on left half of screen but blurry on right half. When you adjust the right half - then the left half is blurry. Manufacturer needs to improve the focus mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: ASH

customer_reviews.title: Nice small size
customer_reviews.text: This projector has served its purpose very well. Nice small size, good resolution, and impressive brightness. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Reiter

customer_reviews.title: Won't play all video formats
customer_reviews.text: Cant get this thing to play video from a DVD player, one of the more important points for buying it.
customer_reviews.author: MAN

customer_reviews.title: Poor embedded software
customer_reviews.text: VERY loud fan. Poor embedded software. Overall, very disappointing product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most important was wireless to work with PC, it didn't.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't do what I expected. Need it to work with PC without wires. It doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bright image but programs are confusing and awkward. Cheap construction makes it extremely difficult to focus. Duh!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

product_meta.title: AAXA KP-700-01 P700 WXGA LED Pico Projector, 650 Lumens, 70+ Min Battery, Native 1280x800 HD Resolution, 15,000 Hour LED, HDMI, Media Player, DLP
product_meta.description: Style:P700AAXA Technology introduces the new P700 an LED projector that again raises the bar in mobile projection by offering more than double the brightness of the original award-winning P300. The AAXA P700 features a re-designed 3rd generation DLP optical engine. This revolutionary "turbocharged" optical system compresses higher density solid-state LED technology into a small form factor enabling 650 Lumens of brightness from a Pico sized optical engine. With a WXGA native resolution the result is a fully mobile true HD projector capable of producing a vibrant 150" image (in dark areas) at a stunning 1280x800 pixel resolution.
feature_bullets: Native 1280x800 HD resolution with 1080p Max Input, featuring Texas Instruments DLP technology to achieve crisp and clear image.
650 Lumen optical engine with Vibrant Color Technology. Long Lasting Premium LEDs ensure there is no need for lamp replacement.
Wide range of connectivity - HDMI, mini VGA, 3.5mm Aux Out, Composite A/V along with Micro SD and USB readers. Built-in Speaker and Onboard Media Player for Direct File Playback.
Ultra portable at 5.9" x 3.9" x 1.6" size and weighs only 1.37 lbs with a 70min rechargeable Lithium-Ion battery. Includes power adapter.
Perfect for Business and Home use with up to 150" projection (in low light conditions). Includes remote and mini tripod for easy setup and navigation.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars73 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
